item.title: Are AI Detectors Good Enough? A Survey on Quality of Datasets With Machine-Generated Texts
item.description: AI-generated text detection is flawed; this paper reveals dataset quality issues, proposes evaluation methods, and shows how high-quality generated data can improve detection model accuracy.

item.title: BiGR: Harnessing Binary Latent Codes for Image Generation and Improved Visual Representation Capabilities
item.description: BiGR: A novel image generation model using compact binary codes, unifying generation and discrimination for superior performance and zero-shot generalization across various vision tasks.

item.title: EvoPress: Towards Optimal Dynamic Model Compression via Evolutionary Search
item.description: EvoPress: A new evolutionary search method achieves optimal dynamic LLM compression, surpassing current techniques in accuracy and efficiency across various compression methods.

item.title: How Do Training Methods Influence the Utilization of Vision Models?
item.description: Training methods profoundly alter how neural networks utilize their layers, revealing that efficient training prioritizes early layers while adversarial training emphasizes deeper ones.

item.title: Montessori-Instruct: Generate Influential Training Data Tailored for Student Learning
item.description: Montessori-Instruct optimizes synthetic training data for LLMs by aligning it with student learning preferences, significantly boosting student model performance.

item.title: NaturalBench: Evaluating Vision-Language Models on Natural Adversarial Samples
item.description: NaturalBench: a new benchmark exposes VLMs’ vulnerabilities to natural adversarial samples, highlighting compositionality challenges & bias issues, and promoting dynamic VLM evaluation.

item.title: Teaching Models to Balance Resisting and Accepting Persuasion
item.description: LLMs are taught to both resist harmful and accept helpful persuasion using Persuasion-Balanced Training, resulting in more reliable and collaborative AI.
